Question_1.Context: The study focused on the incorporation of noncanonical amino acids (ncAAs) into proteins using a variant of pyrrolysyl-tRNA synthetase (PylRS).
Question_1.Question: What was the main purpose of incorporating 16 novel ncAAs into proteins using the IPE variant of PylRS?
Question_1.A: To study the effect of ncAAs on protein stability
Question_1.B: To explore the role of ncAAs in enzyme catalysis
Question_1.C: To investigate the impact of ncAAs on protein folding
Question_1.D: To determine the influence of ncAAs on protein expression
Question_1.Source: This work increased the utility of orthogonal translation systems and indicated that protein main-chain modification, enabled by the incorporation of ncAA, might provide a new approach for protein engineering.

Question_2.Context: The study involved the engineering of a lanthanide-dependent alcohol dehydrogenase (PedH) by incorporating various noncanonical amino acids (ncAAs) using the IPE variant of pyrrolysyl-tRNA synthetase (PylRS).
Question_2.Question: What was the impact of incorporating phenyl-lactic acid (25) into PedH?
Question_2.A: It decreased the catalytic efficiency towards methanol
Question_2.B: It improved the catalytic efficiency towards methanol
Question_2.C: It altered the enantioselectivity of PedH
Question_2.D: It had no effect on the enzyme activity
Question_2.Source: The incorporation of phenyl-lactic acid (25) improved the catalytic efficiency of PedH toward methanol by 1.8-fold.

Question_3.Context: The study involved the incorporation of various noncanonical amino acids (ncAAs) into a lanthanide-dependent alcohol dehydrogenase (PedH) using the IPE variant of pyrrolysyl-tRNA synthetase (PylRS).
Question_3.Question: What was the effect of incorporating O-tert-Butyl-L-tyrosine (8) into PedH?
Question_3.A: It decreased the enantioselectivity of PedH
Question_3.B: It improved the enantioselectivity of PedH
Question_3.C: It reduced the catalytic efficiency of PedH
Question_3.D: It had no impact on the enzyme activity
Question_3.Source: Incorporation of O-tert-Butyl-L-tyrosine modified the enantioselectivity of PedH by influencing the interactions between substrate and protein.

Question_4.Context: The study involved the incorporation of various noncanonical amino acids (ncAAs) into a lanthanide-dependent alcohol dehydrogenase (PedH) using the IPE variant of pyrrolysyl-tRNA synthetase (PylRS).
Question_4.Question: What was the purpose of incorporating 8 different ncAAs into the lanthanide-dependent alcohol dehydrogenase PedH?
Question_4.A: To study the effect of ncAAs on protein folding
Question_4.B: To explore the role of ncAAs in enzyme catalysis
Question_4.C: To investigate the impact of ncAAs on protein stability
Question_4.D: To determine the influence of ncAAs on protein expression
Question_4.Source: This work increased the utility of orthogonal translation systems and indicated that protein main-chain modification, enabled by the incorporation of ncAA, might provide a new approach for protein engineering.

Question_5.Context: The study focused on the incorporation of noncanonical amino acids (ncAAs) into proteins using a variant of pyrrolysyl-tRNA synthetase (PylRS).
Question_5.Question: What was the significance of the N346A mutation in MmPylRS?
Question_5.A: It decreased the binding of PylRS with Pyl
Question_5.B: It increased the catalytic efficiency of PylRS
Question_5.C: It enhanced the steric hindrance preventing Phe binding
Question_5.D: It improved the recognition of small para-substituents
Question_5.Source: The N346A mutation significantly decreased the binding of PylRS with Pyl.

Question_6.Context: The study involved the engineering of a lanthanide-dependent alcohol dehydrogenase (PedH) by incorporating various noncanonical amino acids (ncAAs) using the IPE variant of pyrrolysyl-tRNA synthetase (PylRS).
Question_6.Question: What was the effect of the C348A mutation in MmPylRS?
Question_6.A: It decreased the binding of PylRS with Pyl
Question_6.B: It increased the catalytic efficiency of PylRS
Question_6.C: It enhanced the steric hindrance preventing Phe binding
Question_6.D: It improved the recognition of small para-substituents
Question_6.Source: The C348A mutation was thought to generate a larger hydrophobic active site pocket, making it easier to recognize Phe derivatives with bulky and hydrophobic para substituents.

Question_7.Context: The study involved the incorporation of various noncanonical amino acids (ncAAs) into a lanthanide-dependent alcohol dehydrogenase (PedH) using the IPE variant of pyrrolysyl-tRNA synthetase (PylRS).
Question_7.Question: What was the impact of the steric hindrance of para substituents on the activity of the IPE variant?
Question_7.D: It had no effect on the activity against 4-nitro-L-Phe
Question_7.Source: The steric hindrance of the para substituents of 28, 54, and 55 was similar to O-methyl-L-tyrosine, but the IPE variant had low or no activity against them.

Question_8.Context: The study involved the incorporation of various noncanonical amino acids (ncAAs) into a lanthanide-dependent alcohol dehydrogenase (PedH) using the IPE variant of pyrrolysyl-tRNA synthetase (PylRS).
Question_8.Question: What was the outcome of incorporating 4-nitro-L-Phe (28) into sfGFP using the IPE variant?
Question_8.A: It showed no incorporation into sfGFP
Question_8.B: It resulted in partial incorporation into sfGFP
Question_8.C: It led to complete incorporation into sfGFP
Question_8.D: It caused misincorporation of Lys and Phe into sfGFP
Question_8.Source: The majority of incorporation in the protein was Phe, with only a limited-portion incorporation of 28.

Question_9.Context: The study involved the incorporation of various noncanonical amino acids (ncAAs) into a lanthanide-dependent alcohol dehydrogenase (PedH) using the IPE variant of pyrrolysyl-tRNA synthetase (PylRS).
Question_9.Question: What was the effect of the F412OBT mutation on the enantioselectivity of PedH?
Question_9.D: It had no impact on the enantioselectivity
Question_9.Source: The incorporation of O-tert-Butyl-L-tyrosine (8) changed the enantioselectivity of PedH, showing higher activity toward (S)-2-butanol than (R)-2-butanol.

Question_10.Context: The study involved the incorporation of various noncanonical amino acids (ncAAs) into a lanthanide-dependent alcohol dehydrogenase (PedH) using the IPE variant of pyrrolysyl-tRNA synthetase (PylRS).
Question_10.Question: What was the impact of incorporating 3-I-Phe (1), 3-Br-Phe (2), and 3-Me-Phe (3) into PedH?
Question_10.A: They showed no effect on the activity of PedH
Question_10.B: They decreased the activity of PedH
Question_10.C: They increased the activity of PedH
Question_10.D: They altered the enantioselectivity of PedH
Question_10.Source: The mutants with the incorporation of Phe derivatives 3-I-Phe (1), 3-Br-Phe (2), and 3-Me-Phe (3) having meta-substituents showed the most significant reduction in activity.
